title: Online Instructional Design Course for Strengthening Program Evaluation Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Emphasizing individual device usage, project-based assessment, and team collaboration activities

learning_goals: Learners can apply the six stages of the Cognitive Apprenticeship Model (CAM)—modeling, coaching, scaffolding, articulation, reflective dialogue, and exploration—to develop a program evaluation plan.
Learners can present logical coherence and empirical evidence when writing program evaluation reports by analyzing real-world cases.
Learners can resolve practical issues arising during the program evaluation design process through peer feedback.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
